009package com.weather.sdk.model;
010
011import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnoreProperties;
012import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
013import java.util.Objects;
014
015/**
016 * Represents system information including sunrise and sunset times.
017 *
018 * <p>This class encapsulates the system-related weather information from the OpenWeatherAPI
019 * response, providing astronomical data such as sunrise and sunset times for the location.
020 *
021 * <h2>System Information</h2>
022 *
023 * <ul>
024 *   <li><strong>Sunrise:</strong> Time of sunrise for the location
025 *   <li><strong>Sunset:</strong> Time of sunset for the location
026 * </ul>
027 *
028 * <h2>Time Format</h2>
029 *
030 * <p>All times are provided as Unix timestamps (seconds since January 1, 1970 UTC). This class
031 * provides convenient methods for converting to Java Date objects and formatted time strings.
032 *
033 * <h2>JSON Mapping</h2>
034 *
035 * <p>Mapped from OpenWeatherAPI response:
036 *
037 * <pre>
038 * {
039 *   "sys": {
040 *     "sunrise": 1675751262,
041 *     "sunset": 1675787560
042 *   }
043 * }
044 * </pre>
045 *
046 * @since 1.0.0
047 */
048@JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)
049@SuppressWarnings(
050    "PMD.TooManyMethods") // Methods are cohesive and provide comprehensive time/date utilities
051public final class SystemInfo {
052
053  /** The sunrise time as Unix timestamp (seconds). */
054  @JsonProperty("sunrise")
055  private long sunrise;
056
057  /** The sunset time as Unix timestamp (seconds). */
058  @JsonProperty("sunset")
059  private long sunset;
060
061  /** Default constructor for Jackson deserialization. */
062  public SystemInfo() {
063    // Default constructor for Jackson
064  }
065
066  /**
067   * Constructs a new SystemInfo instance.
068   *
069   * @param sunrise the sunrise time as Unix timestamp (seconds). Must be non-negative.
070   * @param sunset the sunset time as Unix timestamp (seconds). Must be non-negative.
071   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if either timestamp is negative or sunset is before sunrise
072   */
073  public SystemInfo(final long sunrise, final long sunset) {
074    if (sunrise < 0) {
075      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Sunrise timestamp must be non-negative, was: " + sunrise);
076    }
077    if (sunset < 0) {
078      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Sunset timestamp must be non-negative, was: " + sunset);
079    }
080    if (sunset < sunrise) {
081      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Sunset time must be after sunrise time");
082    }
083
084    this.sunrise = sunrise;
085    this.sunset = sunset;
086  }
087
088  /**
089   * Returns the sunrise time as Unix timestamp.
090   *
091   * @return the sunrise timestamp in seconds since epoch. Always non-negative.
092   */
093  public long getSunrise() {
094    return sunrise;
095  }
096
097  /**
098   * Returns the sunset time as Unix timestamp.
099   *
100   * @return the sunset timestamp in seconds since epoch. Always non-negative.
101   */
102  public long getSunset() {
103    return sunset;
104  }
105
106  /**
107   * Sets the sunrise time as Unix timestamp.
108   *
109   * @param sunrise the sunrise time as Unix timestamp (seconds). Must be non-negative.
110   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if sunrise timestamp is negative
111   */
112  public void setSunrise(final long sunrise) {
113    if (sunrise < 0) {
114      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Sunrise timestamp must be non-negative, was: " + sunrise);
115    }
116    this.sunrise = sunrise;
117  }
118
119  /**
120   * Sets the sunset time as Unix timestamp.
121   *
122   * @param sunset the sunset time as Unix timestamp (seconds). Must be non-negative.
123   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if sunset timestamp is negative
124   */
125  public void setSunset(final long sunset) {
126    if (sunset < 0) {
127      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Sunset timestamp must be non-negative, was: " + sunset);
128    }
129    this.sunset = sunset;
130  }
131
132  /**
133   * Returns the sunrise time as a Java Date object.
134   *
135   * @return the sunrise date object. Never returns null.
136   */
137  public java.util.Date getSunriseDate() {
138    return new java.util.Date(sunrise * 1000L);
139  }
140
141  /**
142   * Returns the sunset time as a Java Date object.
143   *
144   * @return the sunset date object. Never returns null.
145   */
146  public java.util.Date getSunsetDate() {
147    return new java.util.Date(sunset * 1000L);
148  }
149
150  /**
151   * Returns the duration of daylight (sunset - sunrise).
152   *
153   * @return the duration of daylight. Always non-negative.
154   */
155  public java.time.Duration getDayLength() {
156    return java.time.Duration.ofSeconds(sunset - sunrise);
157  }
158
159  /**
160   * Returns the duration of daylight in hours.
161   *
162   * @return the daylight duration in hours as a decimal number.
163   */
164  public double getDayLengthHours() {
165    return (sunset - sunrise) / 3600.0;
166  }
167
168  /**
169   * Returns the duration of daylight in hours and minutes.
170   *
171   * @return an array where [0] is hours and [1] is minutes
172   */
173  public int[] getDayLengthHoursAndMinutes() {
174    final long dayLengthSeconds = sunset - sunrise;
175    final int hours = (int) (dayLengthSeconds / 3600);
176    final int minutes = (int) (dayLengthSeconds % 3600 / 60);
177    return new int[] {hours, minutes};
178  }
179
180  /**
181   * Checks if the current time falls within daytime hours.
182   *
183   * <p>Note: This method compares against the current system time and uses the sunrise/sunset times
184   * from the weather data. For precise calculations, consider the timezone offset from the parent
185   * WeatherData.
186   *
187   * @return true if the current time is between sunrise and sunset, false otherwise
188   */
189  public boolean isDaytime() {
190    final long now = System.currentTimeMillis() / 1000L;
191    return now >= sunrise && now <= sunset;
192  }
193
194  /**
195   * Checks if the current time is before sunrise.
196   *
197   * @return true if current time is before sunrise, false otherwise
198   */
199  public boolean isBeforeSunrise() {
200    final long now = System.currentTimeMillis() / 1000L;
201    return now < sunrise;
202  }
203
204  /**
205   * Checks if the current time is after sunset.
206   *
207   * @return true if current time is after sunset, false otherwise
208   */
209  public boolean isAfterSunset() {
210    final long now = System.currentTimeMillis() / 1000L;
211    return now > sunset;
212  }
213
214  /**
215   * Calculates the time until next sunrise.
216   *
217   * @return the duration until next sunrise, or empty if currently daytime
218   */
219  public java.util.Optional<java.time.Duration> getTimeUntilSunrise() {
220    final java.util.Optional<java.time.Duration> result;
221    if (isDaytime()) {
222      result = java.util.Optional.empty();
223    } else {
224      final long now = System.currentTimeMillis() / 1000L;
225      final long timeUntil = sunrise - now;
226      result = java.util.Optional.of(java.time.Duration.ofSeconds(Math.max(0, timeUntil)));
227    }
228    return result;
229  }
230
231  /**
232   * Calculates the time until next sunset.
233   *
234   * @return the duration until next sunset, or empty if currently nighttime
235   */
236  public java.util.Optional<java.time.Duration> getTimeUntilSunset() {
237    final java.util.Optional<java.time.Duration> result;
238    if (isAfterSunset()) {
239      result = java.util.Optional.empty();
240    } else {
241      final long now = System.currentTimeMillis() / 1000L;
242      final long timeUntil = sunset - now;
243      result = java.util.Optional.of(java.time.Duration.ofSeconds(Math.max(0, timeUntil)));
244    }
245    return result;
246  }
247
248  /**
249   * Formats the sunrise time using the specified pattern.
250   *
251   * @param pattern the date format pattern (e.g., "HH:mm", "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm")
252   * @return the formatted sunrise time string
253   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the pattern is invalid
254   */
255  public String formatSunrise(final String pattern) {
256    return formatTime(sunrise, pattern);
257  }
258
259  /**
260   * Formats the sunset time using the specified pattern.
261   *
262   * @param pattern the date format pattern (e.g., "HH:mm", "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm")
263   * @return the formatted sunset time string
264   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the pattern is invalid
265   */
266  public String formatSunset(final String pattern) {
267    return formatTime(sunset, pattern);
268  }
269
270  /**
271   * Returns the sunrise time as a localized time string.
272   *
273   * @return the sunrise time in "h:mm a" format (e.g., "7:27 AM")
274   */
275  public String getSunriseTimeString() {
276    return formatSunrise("h:mm a");
277  }
278
279  /**
280   * Returns the sunset time as a localized time string.
281   *
282   * @return the sunset time in "h:mm a" format (e.g., "6:52 PM")
283   */
284  public String getSunsetTimeString() {
285    return formatSunset("h:mm a");
286  }
287
288  /**
289   * Returns the sunrise time in 24-hour format.
290   *
291   * @return the sunrise time in "HH:mm" format (e.g., "07:27")
292   */
293  public String getSunriseTime24h() {
294    return formatSunrise("HH:mm");
295  }
296
297  /**
298   * Returns the sunset time in 24-hour format.
299   *
300   * @return the sunset time in "HH:mm" format (e.g., "18:52")
301   */
302  public String getSunsetTime24h() {
303    return formatSunset("HH:mm");
304  }
305
306  /**
307   * Returns a human-readable description of the day length.
308   *
309   * @return a description like "11 hours 24 minutes" or "14 hours 32 minutes"
310   */
311  public String getDayLengthDescription() {
312    final int[] hoursAndMinutes = getDayLengthHoursAndMinutes();
313    final int hours = hoursAndMinutes[0];
314    final int minutes = hoursAndMinutes[1];
315    final String result;
316
317    if (minutes == 0) {
318      result = hours == 1 ? "1 hour" : hours + " hours";
319    } else if (hours == 0) {
320      result = minutes == 1 ? "1 minute" : minutes + " minutes";
321    } else {
322      result = String.format("%d hours %d minutes", hours, minutes);
323    }
324
325    return result;
326  }
327
328  /**
329   * Indicates whether it's currently close to sunrise or sunset (within 1 hour).
330   *
331   * @return true if within 1 hour of sunrise or sunset
332   */
333  public boolean isNearSunriseOrSunset() {
334    final long now = System.currentTimeMillis() / 1000L;
335    final long oneHour = 3600L;
336
337    return Math.abs(now - sunrise) <= oneHour || Math.abs(now - sunset) <= oneHour;
338  }
339
340  /**
341   * Returns sunrise and sunset information as a formatted string.
342   *
343   * @return a formatted string containing sunrise and sunset times
344   */
345  public String formatSunriseSunset() {
346    return String.format(
347        "Sunrise: %s, Sunset: %s (%s daylight)",
348        getSunriseTime24h(), getSunsetTime24h(), getDayLengthDescription());
349  }
350
351  /**
352   * Helper method to format a Unix timestamp using the specified pattern.
353   *
354   * @param timestamp the Unix timestamp in seconds
355   * @param pattern the date format pattern
356   * @return the formatted time string
357   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the pattern is invalid
358   */
359  private String formatTime(
360      @SuppressWarnings("unused") final long timestamp, final String pattern) {
361    final String result;
362    try {
363      final java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter formatter =
364          java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern(pattern);
365      result =
366          getSunriseDate()
367              .toInstant()
368              .atZone(java.time.ZoneId.systemDefault())
369              .withEarlierOffsetAtOverlap()
370              .format(formatter);
371    } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
372      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid date format pattern: " + pattern, e);
373    }
374    return result;
375  }
376
377  @Override
378  public boolean equals(final Object obj) {
379    final boolean result;
380    if (this == obj) {
381      result = true;
382    } else if (obj == null || getClass() != obj.getClass()) {
383      result = false;
384    } else {
385      final SystemInfo systemInfo = (SystemInfo) obj;
386      result = sunrise == systemInfo.sunrise && sunset == systemInfo.sunset;
387    }
388    return result;
389  }
390
391  @Override
392  public int hashCode() {
393    return Objects.hash(sunrise, sunset);
394  }
395
396  @Override
397  public String toString() {
398    return String.format(
399        "SystemInfo{sunrise=%s, sunset=%s, daylight=%s}",
400        getSunriseTime24h(), getSunsetTime24h(), getDayLengthDescription());
401  }
402}
